ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained much more fluency and ease in speaking and understanding Chinese, which is something that I would have never expected to happen in only one semester.
I have improved my confidence speaking Chinese - I can talk about a variety of topics such as dating, illness, preparing for Chinese Spring Festival in Chinese.
My general Chinese skills (with specific focus on grammar and speaking / pronunciation) improved!
I felt like my Chinese conversational skills improved the most throughout this semester. I am able to better understand every-day Chinese conversation and more-quickly formulate responses.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
This course is incredibly well structured, and although has a very high work load, felt very manageable and all of the assignments were well timed throughout the semester. 

I also appreciated the asynchronous days of teaching since they allowed me to go deeper into the topics by interviewing my friends for example.

There is no way that this course could be improved.

is actually the best - she has so much energy and enthusiasm everyday!! She always tries to make everything engaging by linking together topics and asking interesting questions. She is also very kind and understanding but genuinely wants to see your Chinese improve.

Strengths: Organization (assignments,  due dates, expectations were super clear) and Class Engagement (every was class was very interactive and something to look forward to).

Weaknesses: none

Strengths: teacher engagement and willingness to help students, positive attitude and energy for every class, good variety in types of assignments, special focus on intonation/pronunciation 
Improvements: I think tutorials should be more of casual/everyday conversation to get more practice with listening comprehension on the spot and quickly formulating responses to questions. This would be more beneficial than reading the textbook and answering pre-written questions that we can prepare beforehand.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student who is interested in taking Chinese, since I found it to be absolutely fascinating and very well taught in a way that actually allows you to learn the language. 

However, for those individuals who are not interested in learning Chinese, I would not recommend this course since it is undeniably a very high workload and a very difficult course.

YES!! Especially with Ao Laoshi because she really makes the class so enjoyable - going to Chinese class never felt like a burden because of her enthusiasm. Your Chinese will definitely improve pretty notably; I think my tones are definitely better. Just be prepared for daily work - and lots of David and Helen.
Definitely! It was a great source of Chinese learning and community and the teacher was incredibly supportive.

I would definitely recommend this course! Given that the student is VERY motivated and interested in Chinese language, of course. The Chinese Language Dept. faculty is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the course is beneficial in teaching useful language skills.
